articles.title: South Phyongan Provincial Conference Held to Elect Delegates to WPK Conference
articles.content:
South Phyongan Provincial Conference Held to Elect Delegates to WPK Conference
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The South Phyongan Provincial Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea was held in Phyongsong on Tuesday.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, and delegates elected at the party organizations of the cities and countries and other units performing the same function as theirs' in the province and the party organizations of the provincial institutions.
					
					 The delegates paid silent tribute to General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The presidium was elected there.
					
					 The conference discussed the election of delegates to the WPK Conference.
					
					 Hong In Bom, chief secretary of the South Phyongan Provincial Committee of the WPK who is a delegate to the party organization of Sunchon City, made an address on electing the dear respected Kim Jong Un as a delegate to the WPK Conference.
					
					 Kim Jong Il is a peerlessly elder statesman, peerless patriot and the tender-hearted father of the people with ardent love and boundless devotion to the country and its people, Hong said.
					
					 Kim Jong Un is the supreme leader of the WPK and the Korean people and the destiny and the future of Songun Korea who is leading to victory the revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of building a thriving socialist nation pioneered by President Kim Il Sung and advanced by Kim Jong Il, Hong noted.
					
					 Hong courteously proposed to elect Kim Jong Un as a delegate to the WPK Conference, representing the unanimous will and desire of all the delegates, the party members and other people in the province.
					
					 Ryang Hong Ju, secretary of the provincial party committee, An Guk Thae, chairman of the provincial people's committee, Mun Chan Ho, first secretary of the provincial committee of the youth league, and other speakers fully supported and approved the proposal on electing Kim Jong Un as a delegate to the WPK Conference.
					
					 The speakers made a firm pledge to implement the behests of Kim Jong Il without the slightest concession and deviation and positively contribute to accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of building a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The conference unanimously adopted a decision on electing Kim Jong Un as a delegate to the WPK Conference, reflecting the will and desire of all the party members and other people in the province.
					
					 The conference elected delegates to the WPK Conference.

articles.title: Official of KCST Interviewed by KCNA
articles.content:
Official of KCST Interviewed by KCNA 
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- A vice director of the Space Development Department of the Korean Committee for Space Technology (KCST) was interviewed by KCNA Wednesday as regards the planned launch of the earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-3. 
					 There were questions about the data of the working satellite to be launched on the occasion of the significant Day of the Sun and the visits by foreign experts and reporters. 
					
					 Question: What is the mission of Kwangmyongsong-3, first working satellite in the DPRK?
					
					 Answer: Kwangmyongsong-3 as an earth observation satellite will assess the distribution of forests and natural resources of the DPRK, the level of natural disaster, the crop estimate, etc. and collect data necessary for weather forecast, natural resources prospecting and others. 
					
					Q: What is its capacity? 
					
					A: Kwangmyongsong-3 has video camera mounted on it and will send observation data including pictures to the General Satellite Control and Command Centre. 
					
					 It weighs 100kg and will circle along the solar synchronous orbit at 500km high altitude. Its life is two years. 
					
					Q: The DPRK invited foreign experts and reporters to the satellite launch. What can they observe?
					
					A: They will go to the Sohae Satellite Launching Station to witness carrier rocket Unha-3 on the launching pad and Kwangmyongsong-3. They will watch the preparation for the launch of the carrier rocket with satellite on it in the General Launch Command Centre. They will also visit the General Satellite Control and Command Centre in Pyongyang and see the satellite being launched in a relevant place. 
					
					 We will organize special visits going beyond the international usage to show with transparency the peaceful, scientific and technological nature of the satellite.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Reply Message from Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Reply Message from Syrian President
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on March 25 received a message from Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad in reply to his message of greeting. 
					 The message expressed thanks for sending a message warmly congratulating the Syrian people on the 49th anniversary of the glorious March 8 revolution in Syria.
					
					 It also extended thanks for encouraging the Baath Arab Socialist Party and the government in exerting efforts amid positive support by the masses.
					
					 It sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people greater progress and prosperity under his wise leadership.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Bulgarian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Bulgarian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday had a talk with Bulgarian Ambassador to the DPRK Georgi Peychinov who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulations to Moldovan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulations to Moldovan President
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Nikolai Timofti on his election as president of the Moldovan Republic. 
					 Kim in the message wished the president success in his work for the prosperity of his country, expressing belief that the bilateral relations would develop favorably.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Cote d'Ivoire
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Cote d'Ivoire
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Monday sent a message of greeting to Jeannot Kouadio Ahoussou on his appointment as prime minister of Cote d'Ivoire.
					 The message wished him success in his work for the stability and development of the country.

articles.title: Pomminryon Vice-Chairman Visits Paektusan Secret Camp
articles.content:
Pomminryon Vice-Chairman Visits Paektusan Secret Camp
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) visited the Secret Camp on Mt. Paektu, the birthplace of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, on Wednesday.
					 He laid a bouquet and bowed before the mosaic portraying the images of three commanders of Mt. Paektu erected in the camp.
					
					 Being briefed on the story that leader Kim Jong Il grew up hearing gun reports of the anti-Japanese struggle as a lullaby, he looked round the historic relics there.
					
					 He had a photo taken to memorize his visit to the leader's native home before touring the headquarters log cabin and other places.
					
					 Prior to this the vice-chairman visited the Samjiyon Grand Monument where he laid a bouquet before the statue of President Kim Il Sung. He paid tribute to the statue in boundless reverence before going round the group of subsidiary sculptures.

articles.title: City of Ecuador Decides to Award Honorary Citizenship to Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
City of Ecuador Decides to Award Honorary Citizenship to Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu 
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Cuenca City of Azuay Province in Ecuador decided to award honorary citizenship to President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk in the run-up to the Day of the Sun.
					 A decision on conferring titles on them was published at a meeting of the city government on March 19.
					
					 The decision said the city decided to register the three commanders of Mt. Peaktu as honorary citizens, genuine example for humankind revered by the world people, in commemoration of the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Book, Kim Il Sung Prize Winner
articles.content:
Book, Kim Il Sung Prize Winner
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Sung Prize was conferred on "Glorifying the Era of Juche", a collection of reminiscences in the DPRK.
					 The book, made up of 70 volumes, deals with the greatness of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's ideas and theories, the ingenuity of his leadership art and his noble personality.
					
					 More than 13 656 000 copies were printed up till February this year since its Vol. 1 came off the press on Aug. 10, Juche 65 (1976). 
					
					 The book (Vol. 1-70) carries reminiscences of more than 1 140 people, including anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters, officials of party and power bodies, economic organs and working people's organizations and others from all walks of life.
					
					 It features the extraordinary wisdom and leadership ability Kim Jong Il displayed in the course of leading the revolution and construction. 
					
					 It also tells about stories of loving care Kim Jong Il had shown for the people on his field guidance tour.
					
					 The book, published at the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House, has been popular among servicepersons and people, as it is a showcase of his revolutionary activities.

articles.title: Korean People Sorely Miss Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Korean People Sorely Miss Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Yearning for General Secretary Kim Jong Il has run high among the Korean people since he passed away more than 100 days ago.
					 The yearning is more ardent among those who met Kim Jong Il during his guidance tour of their worksites a few days before his demise.
					
					 Kim Yong Ok, manager of the Kwangbok Area Supermarket in Pyongyang, told KCNA:
					
					 "As days go by, I sorely miss leader Kim Jong Il, who had worked heart and soul for the wellbeing of the people. 
					
					 In his lifetime, he regarded it as his principle to ensure an enjoyable life to the people. I will devotedly work for the people, true to his lifetime intention."
					
					 Kim Yun Ha, manager of the Hana Electronic Joint Venture Company and director of the Hana Music Information Center, said:
					
					 "The benevolent image of the leader, who had come to the Center to give guidance over our work, is still vivid in my memory.
					
					 The Center has developed a variety of multi-functional audio products from the beginning of this year. 
					
					 Sooner or later, Hana-trademarked electronic products will find their way to consumers to help better their emotional life."

articles.title: "Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (13)
articles.content:
"Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (13)
Kim Il Sung's Distinguished Leadership Ability Displayed in War
					
					 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung strengthened the cohesion of the Workers' Party, army and people of Korea in every way during the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953).
					
					 He developed the WPK into an invincible party, the guiding force for victory in the war.
					
					 On October 21, Juche 39 (1950) he initiated forming WPK organizations in the Korean People's Army in order to fully prepare the soldiers politically and ideologically and further enhance the fighting capacity of the army with the party members as vanguard.
					
					 He strengthened the WPK in an organizational and ideological way by timely convening several plenary meetings of its Central Committee.
					
					 He also directed big efforts to rallying all the people around the WPK as one powerful political force.
					
					 On October 1, 1951, he advanced detailed tasks for intensifying the mass political work, through a decision of the Organizing Commission of the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 In line with the decision, the party organizations at all levels conducted political activities to introduce the WPK's policies among the people and instill them with confidence in sure victory.
					
					 Kim Il Sung guided writers and artistes to create many appealing literature and art works in order to encourage the people to win in the war.
					
					He also paid deep attention to enhancing the role of the people's power bodies.
					
					 In February 1952 he delivered a speech "The Tasks and Role of the Local Organs of Power at the Present Stage" at a joint meeting of people's committee chairmen and leading Party officials of provinces, cities and counties. In the speech he clarified the character and features of the people's power and indicated tasks and ways for enhancing its function and role under the wartime conditions.
					
					 In the course of implementing the tasks, the revolutionary mass viewpoint was strictly established among the government officials and the function and role of people's power organs were enhanced.
					
					 During the war the President always found himself among servicepersons, guiding the army and people to victory in the war. 
					
					 One day when the battle was going on on Height 1 211, he made a phone call to the commander of the KPA unit there. He told the commander that the officers should show deep care for the soldiers' living conditions, saying that all of them were most valuable and his comrades-in-arms.
					
					 He took measures to supply fruits to soldiers fighting in the front and provide them with recreation conditions.
					
					 There are also such touching stories about emergency measures he took to rescue some KPA soldiers from the enemy's encirclement and dispatch soldiers to save a serviceperson's child in the period of the temporary strategic retreat.
					
					 In the three-year war the President made field guidance tours of 1,056 units, extending more than 20,500 km.
					
					 Deeply moved by his ardent spirit of defending the homeland and deep love, the servicepersons and civilians courageously turned out in the fight for victory in the war.

articles.title: UN Chief Should Give up His Biased Attitude: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
UN Chief Should Give Up His Biased Attitude: KCNA Commentary 
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon was reported to make absurd remarks over the issue of the DPRK's planned launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3. 
					 Ban said he was "seriously concerned" about a plan of the north "to fire a missile," "it threatens peace and security of the Korean Peninsula" and that he urged the north "to reconsider its decision in line with its recent undertaking to refrain from long-range missile launches".
					
					 This is unbecoming to his post as the UN chief. 
					
					 It is beyond any doubt that the launch of Kwangmyongsong-3 strictly in line with international regulations and practices will demonstrate the dignity and might of the Korean nation before the whole world and make a positive contribution to the worldwide development of space and scientific researches. 
					
					 Ban Ki-moon as a compatriot should have hailed the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes. But he sympathized with the anti-DPRK policy of hostile forces including the U.S. and Japan. This is, from every angle, an act of besmirching the face of the UN whose life and soul is impartiality. 
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that he asserted the DPRK's satellite launch is a violation of the UNSC "resolution." 
					
					 UNSC "resolution 1874" is a product of a despicable plot hatched as a result of the illegal high-handed action of the U.S. which denied the legitimate right of the sovereign DPRK to launch satellites and the UNSC which followed it. 
					
					 This lacks any ground in view of international law and is based on enmity, inveterate rejection of a country having a social system different from theirs and high-handed and arrogant thought that a small country must obey a big power. 
					
					 He must know this and if he is not aware of this, his qualifications are doubtful. 
					
					 Had the DPRK done as claimed by him, it would have never been able to get any chance to exercise the right to launch a satellite and use space though other countries are free to do so. 
					
					 Precisely for this reason the DPRK categorically rejected the UNSC "resolutions" after the UNSC adopted them in wanton violation of the sovereignty of the DPRK in the past. 
					
					 The anti-DPRK "resolutions", which the U.S. and other hostile forces use as cards for pressurizing the DPRK, were adopted at the UN in violation of international law. Ban Ki-moon is also to blame for them. 
					
					 It was the application of double standards in the development and use of space that the UN adopted a "resolution" over the issue of the DPRK's satellite launch. 
					
					 Many countries of the world have put different kinds of satellites into space since mankind embarked upon the road of conquering space. But none of them was criticized at the UN. 
					
					 For example, the U.S., which is terming the DPRK's projected satellite launch a "grave provocation," put all kinds of satellites including military ones into space, threatening peace and security of the world. But none of them was brought up for discussion. The same can be said of satellite launches by Japan, south Korea and other allies of the U.S. 
					
					 If the UN secretary general is to properly perform his mission and role, he is required, above all, to take an impartial approach and accurately confirm, to begin with, what is true, instead of taking a biased attitude, listening to one side's assertion. 
					
					 The DPRK's launch of working satellite is an exercise of independent and legitimate right in line with the universally accepted international law on the peaceful use of space including the Outer Space Treaty reflecting the unanimous will of the international community which stands higher than the UNSC resolution. 
					
					 The DPRK will as ever never allow any action to infringe upon its dignity and sovereignty in the international arena.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Snubs Anti-DPRK "Resolution"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Snubs Anti-DPRK "Resolution" 
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Forces hostile to the DPRK adopted a "resolution" against it at the 19th session of the UN Human Rights Council.
					 The "resolution" pressurized the DPRK to recognize "the special rapporteur" and "cooperate" with him in his field survey, asserting that it expressed "serious concern over the human rights situation in the north" as in the past.
					
					 The DPRK strongly refutes the "resolution" as a product of political plot to tarnish the image of the DPRK in the international arena and an unpardonable infringement upon the sovereign state.
					
					 The most wanton human rights abuse finds its manifestation in such infringement upon state sovereignty as interfering in the internal affairs of other countries or occupying them by force of arms. The worst human rights abuser is the country which hatches such plots and those countries subservient to it.
					
					 It is preposterous to talk about someone's "human rights" disregarding their own serious human rights issues. This behavior amounts to the height of selectivity and double standards. 
					
					 Great irony is that Japan, a political pigmy, worked hard to have an anti-DPRK "resolution" adopted every year as an ill-famed shock brigade.
					
					 Japan is a war criminal state already bereft of moral and legal rights to talk about "human rights" in the DPRK.
					
					 Japan forcibly took away at least 8.4 million Koreans and mercilessly killed more than a million of them. Moreover, it perpetrated such most hideous human rights abuses in human history as forcing 200 000 Korean women into sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army last century. 
					
					 Terrorism against Koreans in Japan, overseas citizens of a sovereign state, and the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, their legitimate organization, to say nothing of kidnapping and human traffic, are daily occurrences in Japan. This is the reality of Japan.
					
					 It is preposterous and impudent for Japan to utter this or that about someone's "human rights" and behave ridiculously in the international arena.
					
					 Japan works hard to deliberately hype the DPRK's "human rights issue" under the pretext of "abduction issue" in the international arena. Lurking behind this is a foolish intention to paint the "abduction issue" as the core issue of the DPRK-Japan relations and craftily evade the settlement of its past crimes.
					
					 Japan's trumpeting about "human rights" is nothing but a smokescreen to cover up its inglorious past and present human rights abuses.
					
					 No matter how hard the Japanese authorities may try to hide the crimes it committed against the Korean people while peddling the "abduction issue", the Korean people will force them to pay a thousand-fold dearer price for all their past wrongdoings.
					
					 It is no more than a daydream for the forces hostile to the DPRK including Japan to do harm to the DPRK's state sovereignty through conspiracy and pressure.
					
					 The Korean people will more dynamically advance to defend the socialist system dearer than their own lives, holding higher the banner of Songun.

articles.title: WPK Leadership Is Decisive Guarantee for Victory of Socialist Cause: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
WPK Leadership Is Decisive Guarantee for Victory of Socialist Cause: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea is an invincible revolutionary party that has dynamically advanced the socialist cause with the ever-victorious leadership.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The WPK's leadership provides a decisive guarantee for strengthening the driving force of the revolution and steadily raising its role, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					 The WPK clarified long ago that the leader holds an absolute position and plays a decisive role in the revolution and construction. It has always put great efforts into rallying all the service persons and people around the leader. 
					
					 Thanks to the wise leadership of the party, the army and people of the DPRK have formed a socio-political organism that has achieved an integral unity with the leader in terms of organization and ideology and in the sense of moral obligation. 
					
					 The party has relied on the popular masses and given full play to their strength in order to push forward the socialite cause. The validity and vitality of the party's leadership over the masses have been clearly proved in practice.
					
					 Our party has given full play to the advantages of Korean-style socialism and firmly preserved the revolutionary principle under the uplifted banner of independence.
					
					 Thanks to the wise leadership of the party, the Korean people could steadily preserve the true character of socialism and step up the building of Korean-style economic power.
					
					 Under the party's Songun leadership, our socialist fortress has been cemented to be invincible that no enemy dare ever provoke.
					
					 The DPRK army and people are unswervingly following the path of socialism, confident of their victory under the leadership of the WPK, the article concludes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Kim Jong Il's Exploits for National Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Kim Jong Il's Exploits for National Reunification 
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was the peerless patriot and tender-hearted father of the nation who performed undying feats by devoting himself to national reunification till the last moments of his life after he embarked on the sacred road for the country and the nation. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the Three Principles of National Reunification, the 10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, precious legacies bequeathed by President Kim Il Sung, as the Three Charters for National Reunification. This was a great feat which helped the cause of national reunification of Koreans dynamically advance along the road indicated by the President. 
					
					 While leading the cause of national reunification, Kim Jong Il made sure that the stand of independence was consistently preserved in the effort for solving the reunification issue on the principle of national independence by the concerted efforts of the Koreans. 
					
					 He pursued the broad-minded politics of national unity to closely rally all Koreans under the banner of patriotism and make a steady progress in the movement for national reunification. 
					
					 He provided the Korean nation with the June 15 joint declaration the core of which is the idea of "By our nation itself" and the October 4 declaration, thus giving a landmark for national reunification in the 21st century and laying a firm foundation for realizing the nation's centuries-old desire. 
					
					 National reunification, a life-long wish of Kim Jong Il, will surely come true under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un who is leading the cause of Korean reunification with a strong sense of patriotism, far-sighted wisdom and outstanding leadership ability.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Sparking Arms Race
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Sparking Arms Race
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- U.S. Navy's engineers were reported to have recently fired the Navy's first industry-built electromagnetic railgun (EM Railgun) prototype launcher, a future long-range tactical weapon. The future tactical weapon for ships can hit surface, air and ground targets up to 100 miles away by use of motive energy five times faster than sound. When fully developed, the EM Railgun will be massively manufactured to be deployed on warships. 
					 Meanwhile, the U.S. warlike forces opened to media for the first time the latest electromagnetic gun, which had been so far developed in camera. 
					
					 The U.S. development of latest weapons is a revelation of the criminal scenario to ensure military edge and expand the sphere of its dominance in the Asia-Pacific region. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined commentary. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. arms buildup is sparking a new Cold War and arms race. 
					
					 Countries of the region have already sensitively reacted to the U.S. arms buildup and taken measures for bolstering military capability to cope with the possible situation in the future. 
					
					 There is no need to explain what consequences this situation will entail. 
					
					 To step up the arms buildup, blinded by the wild ambition for world domination, is a dangerous adventure foolish enough to dig one's own grave. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to face up to the situation and give up a foolish attempt and ambition for strengthening the military domination over the Asia-Pacific region.

articles.title: Ro Su Hui's Condolatory Visit to DPRK Supported by Overseas Compatriots Organizations
articles.content:
Ro Su Hui's Condolatory Visit to DPRK Supported by Overseas Compatriots 
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The European Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) and the Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany issued a joint statement on Mar. 25 in support of the condolatory visit to Pyongyang paid by Ro Su Hui, vice chairman of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon.
					 The statement warmly welcomed Ro Su Hui for his rightful deed.
					
					 The vice-chairman is on a visit to Pyongyang to take part in memorial service on the 100th day since the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. It is a great and patriotic decision prompted by his will to implement the June 15 Joint Declaration and October 4 Declaration and pave the way for peace and reconciliation, while rejecting war and confrontation, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Although the north-south relationship was plunged into the worst phase due to the immoral and corrupt behavior of the south Korean authorities which hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, all the members of the South Headquarters have turned out to defend and carry out the Three Principles of National Reunification, defying the "Security Law", the worst evil law in the world.
					
					 The statement called upon all the compatriots to turn out in the just struggle of the South Headquarters in unity.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Praises DPRK's Planned Satellite Launch
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Praises DPRK's Planned Satellite Launch
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- South Korean internet paper Jaju Minbo carried an article on Mar. 23 on the DPRK's planned launch of earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-3.
					 The article accused the U.S. and its allies like Japan and south Korea of their wrongdoings as regards the launch.
					
					 It went on: 
					
					 What is of greatest concern with regard to the north's launch of Kwangmyongsong-3 is the scientific and technological level that the north has reached. 
					
					 The north launched a satellite in 2009.
					
					 Kwangmyongsong-3 to be lifted off by carrier rocket Unha-3 is an earth observation satellite going round the polar orbit. The north developed the experimental communications satellite into the pole-orbiting earth observation satellite.
					
					 A director of a research centre noted with appreciation that Kwangmyongsong-3 is apparently an artificial satellite, adding this is a clear reminder of the high-level technology of manufacturing satellites of the north.
					
					 He said the north is likely to launch a lunar explorer satellite.
					
					 The announcement of the projected satellite launch was neither surprising nor unexpected, he said, and went on:
					
					 On Aug. 31, 2008, the 10th anniversary of the launch of the Kwangmyongsong-1, Radio Pyongyang said that the DPRK is on the level of launching a desired working satellite any time if has a will and the DPRK will launch into space a lot of satellites called Kwangmyongsong.
					
					 What is more surprising is the DPRK's announcement that it will live-broadcast the launch of Kwangmyongsong-3. The north said that it would invite experts and mediapersons from around the world to the launching station to observe the launch. 
					
					 The article concluded that amid commemorations of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung, the world would see Kwangmyongsong-3 entering into the orbit, adding that April is a much-looked forward month.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Nuclear Racket Denounced by S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Nuclear Racket Denounced by S. Korean Organization
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The Might of People Transforming Society of south Korea held a press conference on Mar. 26 in Seoul denouncing the anti-DPRK nuclear racket of the south Korean authorities. The Might of People is composed of more than 40 organizations of south Korea including the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of Peasants Associations.
					 At the conference the speakers said the "Nuclear Security Summit" held in Seoul focused on defending the imperialists' nuclear monopoly and domination under the pretext of nuclear control.
					
					 The aim of the summit was to justify the pressure on countries, including the DPRK, which challenge the U.S., they noted, adding the south Korean authorities did not try to hide it, either.
					
					 They said they are strongly opposed to the summit as it was aimed to maintain and beef up the nuclear supremacy under the signboard of realizing a "world without nuclear weapons."
					
					 On the same day civic and social organizations including the Citizen's Solidarity for Democratic Society held a rally at which they said it is hypocritical to talk about nuclear security while shunning the issue of dismantling nuclear weapons of big powers.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Chides Authorities for Failing to Draw Lesson from "Cheonan" Tragedy
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Chides "Government" for Failing to Draw Lesson from "Cheonan" Tragedy
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore Monday carried an editorial titled "Our society's incompetence--failure to draw a lesson from the 'Cheonan' tragedy."
					 Two years have passed since the "Cheonan" warship sinking case took place, but conflict and antagonism are going on over this issue in south Korean society, a proof of ideological and political deviations, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 A specific expression of this was the refusal to confirm lawyer Jo Yong Hwan as a judge of the Constitutional Court. 
					
					 Jo Yong Hwan said shortly ago: "It is not appropriate to use word 'conviction' in the results of the governments' investigation that claimed 'Cheonan' case was the deed of the north as I did not witness the case at the first hand." 
					
					 Much upset by this, the "government", the ruling party and conservative media considered his remarks as disturbing ones, launching an ideological and political offensive against him which resulted in his failure to get confirmed.
					
					 There has never been a free discussion on the truth about the "Cheonan" case in our society.
					
					 There is no chance to have a proper discussion on truth in the light of the situation in which even Jo's statement is regarded as dangerous.
					
					 There is still such suspicion about the case that even former U.S. Ambassador in Seoul Donald Gregg distrusts the announcement of the "government".
					
					  No pressure can wrest conviction from people.
					
					  More tragic is such incompetence as to fail to draw a proper lesson from the said case.
					
					 Meanwhile, the south Korean internet paper Saram Ilbo in an article on the same day demanded a thorough probe into the truth of the case.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Blocking Condolatory Visits to North
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Blocking Condolatory Visits to North
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) made public a statement on Mar. 24 in denunciation of the "government' authorities" unethical behavior.
					 Recalling that Ryu U Ik, minister of Unification, flatly turned down the application of the organization for paying a condolatory visit to the north on the 100th day since the demise of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, the statement branded it as an unethical, reckless act of the dictatorial "government."
					
					 There prevails such critical situation that no one knows when a war may break out due to the worst confrontation caused by those guys including Lee Myung Bak and Kim Kwan Jin who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. It is, therefore, the minimum way for putting the situation under control by letting even mourners of a non-governmental body visit the north to express condolences as they are not in a position to do so under this situation, the statement added.
					
					 Nevertheless, the authorities blocked the condolatory visit of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon at last, it noted, warning the present "government" is bound to face unabated curse and denunciation from compatriots and terrible actions for punishing them. 
					
					 It held that the authorities should be held responsible for dictatorial action of hamstringing the efforts of the Headquarters to improve the north-south relations.
					
					 The organization will wage a stubborn struggle to bring down dictatorship and protect peace from a war under the banner of "By our nation itself," it concluded.

articles.title: S. Korean Personage on Injustice of "Nuclear Security Summit"
articles.content:
S. Korean Personage Discloses Injustice of "Nuclear Security Summit"
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- A permanent representative of the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea posted on an internet homepage on March 26 an article disclosing the injustice of the authorities' anti-DPRK nuclear racket.
					 The Seoul "nuclear security summit" is actually focused on posing a nuclear threat, not nuclear security, the article said, and continued:
					
					 The arch criminal who was the first to use nuclear weapons in the world and is still keen to start a nuclear war by use of a lot of nuclear weapons is talking about nuclear control over someone. This is just like a chief culprit behaving like a prosecutor.
					
					 The summit was prompted by a sinister intention to lay a groundwork for justifying the nuclear war racket and boost the nuclear hegemony and thus pressurize the north to all intents and purposes. It is quite natural for the people from all walks of life in south Korea to have turned out in the actions against the summit.

articles.title: S. Korean Expert Denies Story about "Cheonan" Warship's Sinking by Explosion
articles.content:
S. Korean Expert Denies Story about "Cheonan" Warship's Sinking by Explosion 
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- An engineering expert belonging to the south Korean academy of science and technology recently refuted the results of the investigation made public by the "government" as regards the "Cheonan" warship sinking case.
					 He, when interviewed by Media Today on March 20, said that the warship was not sunk by explosion.
					
					 Referring to the fact that as shown by a photo contained in the report on the results of investigation, the part of the warship broken to two pieces was triangular, he said that "in case an explosion happened, the section of the ship would turn into something beyond recognition. From a physical point of view, the explosion cannot happen, causing such section".
					
					  He raised such a question as to how can the gas turbine and its cover be in good shape even after they were strongly shocked by an explosion, if it happened. 
					
					 He held that it was obvious that the accident started when the warship ran on a rock in the light of the conditions of the bow and stern of the warship and its section, etc., when it was salvaged from the bottom of the sea at first.
					
					 Sin Sang Chol, member of the former joint investigation team, who had denied the ship's "sinking owing to explosion," reiterated his view at the court on March 19.
					
					 Had an explosion occurred, the upper part of the section should have gone, he held, adding that this goes to prove that something had directly dashed against the warship.

articles.title: Academic Seminar of Korean Social Scientists in Japan Held
articles.content:
Academic Seminar of Korean Social Scientists in Japan Held 
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- An academic seminar of Korean Social Scientists in Japan took place in Tokyo on March 24 to commemorate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 There was a special forum under the title "President Kim Il Sung, benevolent teacher of Koreans in Japan" at the seminar.
					
					 The floor was taken by Prof. and Dr. Kim Hwa Hyo, Prof. Pyon Jae Su and Dr. and Merited Actor Ri Sung Ok. 
					
					 They referred to the great love shown by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the Korean social scientists in Japan and the days in which they have conducted a fruitful study along the road of Juche, fascinated by the outstanding ideas and theories of the great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 They vowed to fulfill their mission as Korean social scientists in the way of carrying forward the cause of Juche and the patriotic cause of Chongryon initiated by Kim Il Sung and successfully led by Kim Jong Il to the last under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Then followed philosophical, political, linguistic, historical and economic panel discussions.

articles.title: Koreans in Russia Commemorate Day of Sun
articles.content:
Koreans in Russia Commemorate Day of Sun
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Russia held a meeting in Moscow on March 24 to commemorate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bunches of flowers before portraits of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					 Prior to the meeting, a seminar on their feats was held. Speeches were made under the titles "What type of man the great President Kim Il Sung was", "On the issue of Korea's reunification, the desire of Comrade Kim Il Sung in his lifetime", "On the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung", "On the Juche idea and Songun politics" and "The idea and cause of Comrade Kim Il Sung, the founder of the DPRK, were developed in depth by the great Comrade Kim Jong Il and will be carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un".
					
					 The speakers said the President was a peerlessly patriot and the father of the nation whom the Korean people greeted and held in high esteem for the first time in the history spanning thousands of years and the outstanding statesman recognized by the world.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche which was pioneered by the President and led by Kim Jong Il along the ever-victorious road is being steadfastly carried forward by Kim Jong Un, they noted.
					
					 The floor was taken by those who had the honor of being received by the President and those related to his revolutionary activities.
					
					 Looking back with deep emotion on those unforgettable days when they had the honor of being received by the President, they said they were attracted by his tender-hearted personality and inborn disposition.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar.
					
					 Then followed a remembrance concert.

articles.title: Koreans in Russia Mourn Kim Jong Il on 100th Day from His Demise
articles.content:
Koreans in Russia Mourn Kim Jong Il on 100th Day from His Demise
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Russia held a memorial service on March 25, the 100th day since the demise of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The participants laid wreaths and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and observed a moment's silence for him.
					
					 The chairman of the confederation made a memorial speech.
					
					 He said that Kim Jong Il defended the country's sovereignty and the people's destiny with his outstanding Songun politics during the most difficult period of the country. He praised Kim Jong Il, saying that he turned the DPRK into a nuclear weapons state which no imperialists dare provoke.
					
					 He noted that national reunification was the biggest desire of Kim Jong Il, calling upon all the overseas Koreans to make positive efforts for reunification under the uplifted banner of "By our nation itself".
					
					 Kim Jong Il will remain alive in the hearts of not only the Korean people but other people in the world, he emphasized.
					
					 Then the chairperson of the Scientist Association of Koreans in Russia made a speech:
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il always paid deep concern to the country's development of science and technology and it was entirely attributable to his idea of giving importance to science and technology that the DPRK developed into a nuclear weapons state and a country with ability to manufacture and launch satellite.
					
					 Representatives of the confederation visited the mourning station in the DPRK embassy in Moscow and laid a wreath and bouquets to memorize Kim Jong Il that day.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Introduced in Pakistan
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Introduced in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The March issue of Pakistani magazine Diplomatic Focus carried contents of various parts of President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century".

articles.title: Day of Sun Observed
articles.content:
Day of Sun Observed 
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Meetings, lectures, remembrance meetings and photo exhibitions were held in Ecuador, Guinea, Romania and Bulgaria between March 17 and 21 to mark the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display in the venues were photos of the sacred revolutionary careers of the President and General Scretary Kim Jong Il and their undying feats.
					
					 The chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania said though President Kim Il Sung passed away, the Korean people are boundlessly revering the President as the father of the nation, eternal President of the DPRK and the sun of humankind.
					
					 The chairman of the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People and other speakers lauded the President for defeating U.S. and Japanese imperialisms, firmly defending the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the nation and turning the DPRK into a socialist country centered on the popular masses.
					
					 The chairman of the Bulgarian Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification said the President who embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years firmly protected the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the nation, developed the country into a socialist power and clearly indicated the road for humankind to follow.
					
					 The chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea at Kankan University in Guinea said the President pursued benevolent politics with his warm humanity. 
					
					 The former first secretary of the Pravets City Committee of the Bulgarian Communist Party expressed belief that the Korean people would certainly build a thriving nation and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at a remembrance meeting in Bulgaria.

articles.title: Media of Different Countries Commemorate Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Media of Different Countries Commemorate Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Media of Russia, Uruguay, Pakistan and Bangladesh carried special write-ups to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The 12th issue of Russian paper Patriot devoted its two whole pages to a special write-up interwoven with photos of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The paper said:
					
					 The visitors to the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun pay high tribute to Kim Il Sung, an outstanding leader of progressive humankind. They keenly realize how great his feats are.
					
					 The Kumsusan Palace of the Sun where the great leaders who dedicated all their lives to the country and people lie in state is the place where the progressives all over the world share their reverence for them.
					
					 Uruguayan paper La Juventud on March 20 dedicated its whole page to an article titled "DPRK, Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung" illustrated with the portrait of smiling President.
					
					 The paper noted that all the eye-catching events in the drive for turning the DPRK into a thriving nation at present are the brilliant realization of the ideal and desire of the President.
					
					 The March issue of Pakistani magazine Diplomatic Focus allotted eight pages to a special write-up under the title "On Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung."
					
					 The March 19th issue of Bangladeshi paper Natun Katha carried an article captioned "DPRK, Continuity of Socialist Cause".
					
					 The paper recalled that the President, leading the Korean revolution for years, turned the DPRK into a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence, and that Kim Jong Il successfully carried forward the President's idea and cause.

articles.title: DPRK's Space Policy Hailed
articles.content:
DPRK's Space Policy Hailed
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Foreign personages made public statements on March 21 and 22 in support of the DPRK's projected launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-3. 
					 The chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania pointed out that the launch of Kwangmyongsong-3 is part of scientific researches aimed at developing and using working satellites helpful to the economic development of the DPRK in line with its policy to use space for peaceful purposes.
					
					 He said he is joining progressive mankind in supporting the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea and the scientists' efforts  to develop space technology and expressed belief that the DPRK's efforts to develop  space would make an important contribution to ensuring peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The chairperson of the Malaysian Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of the Birth of President Kim Il Sung said the launch of Kwangmyongsong-3 manufactured by the DPRK by its own efforts with indigenous technology would offer it an opportunity of demonstrating before the whole world that it proudly ranked itself among space powers.
					
					 The DPRK's satellite launch is an issue pertaining to the sovereignty of the Korean people and it is a legitimate right of every country to use outer space for peaceful purposes, the chairperson said.
					
					 The chairman of the Nider Sachsen State Committee of the Communist Party of Germany expressed the expectation that the DPRK would surely succeed in the satellite launch, noting that the successful launch of Kwangmyongsong-3 would help towards the use of space for peaceful purposes, peace and stability of the world and scientific and technological development.

articles.title: Memorial Services on 100th Day of Kim Jong Il's Demise Held in Russia, Italy
articles.content:
Memorial Services on 100th Day of Kim Jong Il's Demise Held in Russia, Italy
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Memorial services took place in Russia and Italy on March 22 and 23 to observe the 100th day since General Secretary Kim Jong Il passed away.
					 Present there were officials of a company of the Russian Technical Glass Research Institute, the Leftwing People's Party of Communists of Italy, the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche idea and the Italian Committee for the Study of Songun Idea for Independence and Sovereignty and masses.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The deputy general manager for science of the company of the Russian Technical Glass Research Institute said that Kim Jong Il was a great friend of the Russian people who made undying contributions to developing the friendly and cooperative relations between Russia and the DPRK. Kim Jong Il will always be alive in the hearts of not only the Korean people but the Russian people, he added.
					
					 The director of the International Department of the Leftwing People's Party of Communists of Italy noted that the progressive political parties and the revolutionary people struggling for socialism and independence are praying for the immortality of Kim Jong Il.   
					
					 The director expressed deep reverence for him who made great contributions to the Korean revolution and global independence.
					
					 The director said that the Korean people are reliably defending Korean-style socialism while shattering the U.S. and all other hostile forces' moves for aggression and war, single-mindedly rallied around the dear respected Kim Jong Un who is reliably carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried in Romanian Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried in Romanian Newspaper
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The gist of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party" was carried by the 194th issue of Romania Muncitoare.
					 The work, published on January 3, Juche 81 (1992), clarifies a historical lesson drawn from socialist construction and the validity of the general line of the Workers' Party of Korea for building socialism.

articles.title: Serbian President Terms NATO Attack Crime
articles.content:
Serbian President Terms NATO Attack Crime
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- Serbian President Boris Tadic, attending Saturday a ceremony commemorating civilian victims of NATO's bombing of former Yugoslavia 13 years ago, said that the bombing was a "crime against a country and people."
					 Serbia will always commemorate the anniversary of the beginning of NATO air strikes by remembering the victims, he pointed out.

articles.title: U.S. Policy on Iran Leads to World Catastrophe: Castro
articles.content:
U.S. Policy on Iran Leads to World Catastrophe: Castro
 Havana, March 27 (KCNA) -- Cuban revolution leader Fidel Castro strongly criticized U.S. bullying stances against Iran and warned against its consequences. 
					 Castro said in an interview with a Russian news agency Saturday that the White House policy toward Iran is catastrophic and the biggest mistake in history.
					
					 He added that U.S. claims against Iran's nuclear program are "baseless and unfounded", adding that enriching uranium in Iran is as an energy source or is used in medical applications.

articles.title: Uganda Reaffirms Rejection of U.S. Blockade on Cuba
articles.content:
Uganda Reaffirms Rejection of U.S. Blockade on Cuba
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The minister of Justice and Constitutional Affairs in Uganda on March 25 highlighted the longstanding friendly relations between Uganda and Cuba and demanded the end of the U.S. blockade against the Caribbean island.
					 The minister reaffirmed that Cuba will continue getting the Ugandan vote at the United Nations in rejection of the U.S. blockade.

articles.title: Vice Foreign Minister of Russia Rejects U.S. Claim
articles.content:
Vice Foreign Minister of Russia Rejects U.S. Claim
 Moscow, March 27 (KCNA) -- Vice Foreign Minister of Russia Sergei Lyavkov in a meeting on March 23 accused the U.S of claiming that it is necessary to establish missile defense system.
					 The U.S. is trying to persuade Russia to establish MD to curb the missile threats from Iran and the DPRK, he said, announcing that Russia does not believe it.
					
					 The missile defense system currently under establishment has strategically uncertain elements with regard to the regions of deployment and the number of interceptor missiles, he added.

articles.title: Iran's FM Spokesman Rejects West's False Report
articles.content:
Iran's FM Spokesman Rejects West's False Report 
 Tehran, March 27 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of Iran on March 23 rejected a Western media report that Iran provided Sudan with weapons. 
					 The spread of the false report by the Western media is aimed to cover up their failure in the region and block the advance of Iran by tightening sanctions, he said. 
					
					 Iran has always maintained the principled stand against war and violence and is of the view that dialogue is the only way of settling disputes among countries, he declared.

articles.title: Tunisian Foreign Minister Supports Iran's Peaceful Nuclear Program
articles.content:
Tunisian Foreign Minister Supports Iran's Peaceful Nuclear Program
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- The Tunisian foreign minister expressed the country's stand of supporting Iran's peaceful nuclear program on March 23.
					 Noting that Iran has the right to develop its own nuclear energy, he reiterated his country's support for Iran's peaceful nuclear activities.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries
 Pyongyang, March 28 (KCNA) -- China and Indonesia on March 23 signed trade agreements, which include nine memoranda of understanding and several intention cooperation pacts, and cover 15 projects in the fields of iron and steel making, textile manufacturing, hydroelectric generation, mining and agriculture.
					 Argentina and Vietnam agreed to promote the two countries' all-sided cooperation in various fields on the same day.

articles.title: Sesionada reunion de delegados de provincia de Phyong-an del Sur
articles.content:
Sesionada reunion de delegados de provincia de Phyong-an del Sur 
Pyongyang, 28 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 27 en la ciudad de Phyongsong la reunion de delegados de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur del Partido del Trabajo de Corea. 
					Asistieron Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, y los delegados elegidos en los comites urbanos y distritales del partido en la provincia, las organizaciones de partido de distintas unidades que cumplen la misma funcion que aquellos y las organizaciones del partido de los organos de nivel provincial.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					El foro eligio la presidencia y discutio el problema de elegir a los delegados a la Conferencia del PTC.
					
					El discurso de propuesta para elegir al Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un como delegado a la Conferencia del PTC estuvo a cargo de Hong In Bom, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en dicha Provincia y delegado de la organizacion partidista de la ciudad de Sunchon.
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il fue el veterano politico nunca visto, el patriota sin igual y afectuoso padre del pueblo, quien dedico toda su vida revolucionaria por la patria y el pueblo con ardiente amor e infinita abnegacion por estos, dijo y continuo: 
					
					Kim Jong Un es el Maximo Dirigente del PTC y el pueblo coreano, destino y futuro de la Corea del Songun, quien conduce a la victoria la causa revolucionaria del Juche, la de construccion del Estado prospero socialista, iniciada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y avanzada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Reflejando la unanime voluntad y aspiracion de todos los delegados y todos los militantes del partido y otros habitantes de la provincia, propuso cortesmente elegir al Maximo Dirigente como delegado a la Conferencia del PTC. 
					
					El secretario del Comite Provincial del Partido, Ryang Hong Ju, el presidente del Comite Popular Provincial, An Kuk Thae, el primer secretario del Comite Provincial de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, Mun Chan Ho, y otros oradores apoyaron y aprobaron por entero la propuesta.
					
					Los oradores expresaron la firme decision de materializar sin alguna concesion ni defecto el legado del Dirigente y contribuir activamente al cumplimiento de la causa revolucionaria del Juche, la de construccion del Estado prospero siguiendo la guia de Kim Jong Un. 
					
					En la ocasion quedo aprobada por unanimidad la resolucion correspondiente en reflejo de la unanime voluntad y deseo de todos los militantes del partido y los habitantes de la provincia.
					
					Luego, fueron electos otros delegados a la Conferencia del PTC.

articles.title: Funcionario del CTEC se entrevista con la ACNC
articles.content:
Funcionario del CTEC se entrevista con la ACNC
Pyongyang, 28 de marzo (ACNC) -- En relacion con el lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3", satelite artificial de observacion de la Tierra, el subdirector de Desarrollo Espacial del Comite de Tecnologias Espaciales de Corea (CTEC) se entrevisto este miercoles con la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea.
					El respondio a las preguntas relacionadas con los datos sobre ese satelite de usos practicos a ser lanzado con motivo del significativo Dia del Sol y con la visita de especialistas y reporteros extranjeros.
					
					Periodista: ?Cual es la mision de "Kwangmyongsong-3", primer satelite de usos practicos de nuestro pais?
					
					Subdirector: "Kwangmyongsong-3" es el satelite de observacion terrestre y determinara el estado de distribucion de recursos forestales, la magnitud de desastres naturales y las perspectivas de rendimiento de cereales en nuestro pais.
					
					Ademas, recogera las informaciones necesarias al pronostico del tiempo y a la prospeccion de recursos naturales.
					
					Periodista: ?Cuales son las especificaciones de "Kwangmyongsong-3"?
					
					Subdirector: La camara instalada en el satelite enviara al Centro de Control General de Satelites los datos de observacion, tales como fotos.
					
					El satelite pesa 100 kilogramos, girara segun la orbita sincronizada solar a la altura de 500km y durara 2 anos.
					
					Periodista: Tengo entendido que el CTEC ha invitado a los especialistas y periodistas de otros paises a ver el lanzamiento del satelite. ?Que mostraran ustedes a ellos?
					
					 Subdirector: Sobre todo, ellos veran con sus propios ojos el cohete transportador "Unha-3" y el satelite artificial "Kwangmyongsong-3", instalados en la plataforma de lanzamiento del Campo de Lanzamiento de Satelites Sohae.
					
					Y tendran la posibilidad de presenciar en vivo en el centro de mando general de lanzamiento la preparacion para el lanzamiento del "Unha-3" y el "Kwangmyongsong-3".
					
					Los huespedes visitaran el Centro de Control General de Satelites, situado en la ciudad de Pyongyang, y veran en vivo en un lugar apropiado el proceso de lanzamiento del satelite.
					
					Para demostrar con transparencia el caracter pacifico y cientifico-tecnico de "Kwangmyongsong-3", tenemos previsto organizar una visita excepcional por encima de costumbres internacionales.

articles.title: Ro Su Hui recorre campamento secreto del monte Paektu
articles.content:
Ro Su Hui recorre campamento secreto del monte Paektu
Pyongyang, 28 de marzo (ACNC) -- Ro Su Hui, vicepresidente de la direccion surena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria (APRP) visito el dia 28 el campamento secreto del monte Paektu.
					Tras depositar un ramo de flores ante el fresco mosaico con las imagenes de los 3 Generales del monte Paektu levantado en el campamento, les  rindio homenaje.
					
					En la historica casa natal del Dirigente           Kim Jong Il, el visitante escucho las explicaciones sobre el hecho de que el Dirigente crecio oyendo como arrullo las detonaciones de fusiles y canones, y vio los objetos de interes historico.
					
					Tomo la foto en memoria de la visita al lugar y dio vuelta por la isba de la Comandancia y otros.
					
					Anteriormente, estuvo en el Conjunto Monumental de Samjiyon donde deposito un ramo de flores ante la estatua del Presidente Kim Il Sung y le rindio tributo con infinito respeto y veneracion a el y dio vuelta por los conjuntos escultoricos subtematicos.

articles.title: ACNC comenta discurso prejuicioso de Ban Ki Moon
articles.content:
ACNC comenta discurso prejuicioso de Ban Ki Moon
Pyongyang, 28 de marzo (ACNC) -- Ultimamente, el secretario general de la ONU Ban Ki Moon pronuncia unas palabras inconformes a su cargo sobre el proximo lanzamiento del satelite artificial "Kwangmyongsong-3" de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, tales como "expresa gran preocupacion del lanzamiento de misil por el Norte de Corea" y "le urge pensar otra vez en ese programa".
					Es indudable que el lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3" segun las normas y costumbres internacionales manifestara a todo el mundo la dignidad y el gallardo aspecto de la nacion coreana y contribuira al desarrollo espacial y la investigacion cientifica en el ambito mundial.
					
					En lugar de aplaudir como compatriota ese programa pacifico de la RPDC, Ban se suma a la politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU., Japon y otras fuerzas hostiles y esta actitud mancha la imagen de la ONU que toma la imparcialidad por su principio vital.
					
					Lo insoslayable del caso es que el cuestiona el lanzamiento de "Kwangmyongsong-3" como violacion de la "resolucion" del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					
					La "resolucion 1874" del Consejo de Seguridad es producto de la sucia conspiracion entre EE.UU., que rehuso el legitimo derecho de la RPDC a lanzar el satelite artificial, y ese aparato de la ONU que abuso de su autoridad adhiriendose al imperio.
					
					Ese documento carece de argumentos en vista del derecho internacional y es caracterizada por la hostilidad y veto al pais que tiene diferente regimen y por la logica de prepotencia segun la cual los paises pequenos deben obedecer a los grandes.
					
					Lo sabra tambien Ban Ki Moon, representante de la magna organizacion internacional, y su calificacion se pondria en entredicho si no lo supiera.
					
					Si acepta lo que dice Ban, la RPDC sera privada una vez por todas del derecho de lanzar satelites y usar el cosmos, el cual ejercen libremente otros paises.
					
					Por esa razon, las "resoluciones" aprobadas anteriormente en el Consejo de Seguridad fueron rechazadas totalmente por el pueblo coreano y los pueblos progresistas del mundo.
					
					El secretario general de la ONU es tambien responsable de la aprobacion de esas "resoluciones" anti-RPDC que usan EE.UU. y las fuerzas hostiles como carta de presion.
					
					El hecho de que la ONU aprobo la polemica "resolucion" cuestionando el lanzamiento de satelite de la RPDC, es evidentemente la pauta de doble rasero en el desarrollo y el uso del cosmos.
					
					Desde cuando la humanidad emprendio la conquista del espacio, numerosos paises lanzaron satelites de distintos tipos, pero ninguno ha sido criticado por eso en los escenarios de la ONU.
					
					Ni siquiera fue mencionada la conducta de EE.UU. que acusa el lanzamiento de satelite de la RPDC como "grave provocacion" amenazando por otra parte la paz y la seguridad de todo el mundo con sus numerosos satelites militares y de otros tipos. Sucedio lo mismo en el lanzamiento de satelites por Japon, el Sur de Corea y otros lacayos del imperio.
					
					Si el secretario general desea cumplir bien su mision y papel, no debe tomar una actitud prejuiciosa sino confirmar primero los hechos desde la posicion imparcial.
					
					El lanzamiento de satelite de usos practicos de la RPDC es el ejercicio de su derecho independiente y legal en virtud del Tratado Espacial, que refleja la voluntad general de la sociedad internacional y esta por encima de la resolucion del Consejo de Seguridad, y de las otras leyes internacionales sobre el uso pacifico del cosmos.
					
					En el futuro tambien, la RPDC no perdonara ningun atentado contra su dignidad y soberania en los escenarios internacionales.

articles.title: ACNC rechaza resolucion anti-RPDC del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU
articles.content:
ACNC rechaza resolucion anti-RPDC del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU
Pyongyang, 28 de marzo (ACNC) -- En la 19a reunion del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU las fuerzas hostiles aprobaron la "resolucion" anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					Al igual que en el pasado, la "resolucion" expresa una "gran preocupacion por la situacion de DDHH del Norte de Corea" y obliga a la RPDC reconocer al "informante especial" y "cooperar" en su inspeccion en el terreno. 
					
					Lo calificamos de producto de complot politico tendente a manchar la imagen exterior de la RPDC en la palestra internacional y de intolerable violacion de un Estado soberano. 
					
					Hoy dia, la mas grave violacion de DDHH es la intervencion en los asuntos internos de otros paises y ocuparlos con las fuerzas armadas, y los peores violadores de DDHH en el mundo son los paises intrigantes y sus seguidores. 
					
					Sin embargo, ellos cuestionan la "situacion de DDHH" de alguien dando vistas gordas a los graves problemas de DDHH de si mismos, lo cual es el climax de la selectividad y la pauta de doble rasero. 
					
					Lo mas ridiculo del caso es que Japon, enano politico, actua cada ano como brigada de choque fijada en aprobar la "resolucion" anti-RPDC. 
					
					Ese pais isleno es el criminal de guerra que ya perdio el derecho moral y legal a cuestionar el problema de "DDHH" de la RPDC. 
					
					En el siglo pasado, los imperialistas japoneses arrestaron a mas de 8 millones 400 mil coreanos, asesinaron sin piedad a mas de un millon y convirtieron a mas de 200 mil mujeres coreanas en las esclavas sexuales de su viejo ejercito. 
					
					En la sociedad japonesa se cometen diariamente los casos de secuestro, el trafico de seres humanos y los actos terroristas contra los coreanos residentes en su pais y la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon), organizacion legitima de ellos. 
					
					A pesar de esto, Japon censura en la arena internacional los "DDHH" de la RPDC bajo el pretexto del "problema de secuestro" con el fin astuto de evadir la liquidacion de su pasado tergiversando lo fundamental de las relaciones RPDC-Japon como si estas partieran del "problema de secuestro". 
					
					Los "DDHH" de que hablan las autoridades japonesas no pasan de ser una cortina de humo para encubrir su pasado vergonzoso y sus presentes actos de violacion de DDHH. 
					
					Por mas que ellas se desesperen por encubrir sus crimenes cometidos contra el pueblo coreano, pretextando el "problema de secuestro", este cobrara sin falta el precio merecido. 
					
					Es una ilusion vana la intencion de Japon y otras fuerzas hostiles de denigrar la soberania coreana con los complots y presion. 
					
					El pueblo coreano enarbolara la bandera del Songun para defender el regimen socialista mas valioso.
